lexUnit.name: decrease.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move downward along some scale

sentence.text: The vast majority of chromosomally unbalanced mouse fetuses die between day 6 and IS ( 8 ) and mitotic activity often decreases several hours or even days prior to the event .
We believe we will continue to gain market share in the North Sea , but the overall level of activity there will probably decrease .

Carbon dioxide increased by 3 million tonnes , but methane levels decreased slightly .
The position concerning part-time students is very different , however ; in the same period , their numbers decreased slightly from 54,843 to 50,486 .
Although Europe was growing , she was falling behind relatively ; her share of world manufacturing output was decreasing and until 1914 most of the rest of that output came from the United States .

Achord noted that the basal acid output decreased after healing of an ulcer by drugs that do not eradicate H pylori , implying that the ulcer crater is itself associated with increased basal acid secretion .
The winter population has decreased in recent years .
During this period the death rate from pancreatitis in the population decreased by 67% ( Table ) .
The EC pig meat reference price decreased by 0.3 per cent in the week ended May 30 to 57.41 per cent of the basic price .
As your fitness improves you will find that your heart rate decreases while performing the same level of exercise .
Pancreatitis death rate decreased from 5.9% ( men 4.8% , women 7.0% ) to 2.6% ( men 2.4% , women 2.7% ) .
Between 1870 and 1930 average completed family size decreased from five or six children to three and has now stabilized at about two .
As a black hole emits particles , its mass and size steadily decrease .
If all goes well , our own production of cholesterol should decrease in relation to the amount we take in from outside .
At the Bank of England public deposits increase and bankers ' deposits decrease by the amount of the sale .
Occasionally , syncopal episodes decrease in frequency and may even disappear with increasing age .
With chlorinated hydrocarbons , the ease of biodegradation decreases as the number of chlorine atoms per molecule increases .
The number of females with whom the male frequently interacts decreases with the size of the group .
More than 35% of marked mussels decreased in size .
The accuracy of the method decreases according to grain size : with finer grained specimens , the pink stain tends to pervade the surface and obscure the quartz grains .
The heart decreases in size and assumes a more vertical position , due to a loss of pericardial fat , reduced left ventricular mass , and decreased blood volume .
Government spending on energy efficiency has decreased by £9.5 million since 1985 .
Harvests decreased by 21.22 per cent and stock markets registered a annual fall in value of 68 per cent .
The risk decreased by 39 weeks ' gestation to about 1.1 per 1000 ( 1 in 909 ) .
Tumour diameter decreased from 4.2 ( 2.8 ) cm to 3.1 ( 1.6 ) cm after irradiation ( p=0.02 ) .
Mr Shaw also reported that net debt had decreased from £63 million to £58 million .
The number of patients who have waited for 12 months or more also decreased significantly from 367 to 293 , " says the report .
But the young fish still suffer and stocks are dwindling , so that fish-eating birds such as the reef egret are decreasing in numbers .
Stroke risk decreases significantly in two years and is about the same as for nonsmokers after five years [ 8 ] .
By 48 hours , the abdominal girth had decreased to 92 cm .
At the same time it is argued that the ability of law to order social and political reality has decreased to a surprising extent .

In contrast to viewing , radio listening generally decreased with age , was highest among the higher social grades and had no female bias .
The variation in day length decreases with distance from the poles and vanishes at the Equator , which receives 12 hours of light each day throughout the year .
The SMM radiometer suggests the Sun 's radiation is decreasing at a rate of 0.06 per cent per year .
From core measurements made under ` room conditions " porosity visibly decreases with increasing depth .

During a match the players ' level of fitness decreases steadily , or suddenly if injured !
